meanings.definition: The amount that a pot can hold.
meanings.sent1: She poured a potful of water into the kettle.
meanings.sent2: The recipe called for a potful of vegetables.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally spilled a potful of soup on the stove.
meanings.sent4: The garden was filled with a potful of colorful flowers.
meanings.sent5: The chef carefully measured out a potful of rice for the dish.

meanings.sent1: The delicious stew simmered in the potful.
meanings.sent2: She stirred the potful of pasta sauce on the stove.
meanings.sent3: The potful of hot cocoa warmed them up on a cold day.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of the potful of coffee filled the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: He eagerly dipped his spoon into the potful of chili.
